books.title: Dune
books.author: Frank Herbert
books.summary: Set in the distant future, Dune follows the story of Paul Atreides as he becomes the messiah-like figure of a desert planet called Arrakis, where a valuable resource known as spice is found.

books.author: George Orwell
books.summary: In a totalitarian society, Winston Smith rebels against the oppressive regime led by Big Brother, questioning the government's control over information and individual freedom.

books.title: Foundation
books.author: Isaac Asimov
books.summary: Spanning centuries, Foundation explores the collapse and rebirth of a galactic empire through the use of psychohistory, a mathematical science that predicts the behavior of large populations.

books.title: Neuromancer
books.author: William Gibson
books.summary: Case, a washed-up computer hacker, is hired for one last job that involves artificial intelligence, virtual reality, and a powerful entity known as Wintermute.

books.title: Ender's Game
books.author: Orson Scott Card
books.summary: Gifted child Ender Wiggin is recruited by the military to train in a battle school in space, where he must face a formidable alien race known as the Formics.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: In a future society where humans are genetically engineered and conditioned for specific roles, Bernard Marx questions the conformity and lack of individuality.

books.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
books.author: Douglas Adams
books.summary: Arthur Dent is whisked away from Earth just before its destruction and embarks on a comedic journey through space with his alien friend Ford Prefect.

books.title: Snow Crash
books.author: Neal Stephenson
books.summary: In a near-future world, Hiro Protagonist, a hacker and pizza delivery driver, uncovers a conspiracy involving a virtual reality drug called Snow Crash.

books.title: The War of the Worlds
books.author: H.G. Wells
books.summary: When Martians invade Earth, an unnamed narrator witnesses the destruction and chaos caused by the technologically advanced alien species.

books.title: Fahrenheit 451
books.author: Ray Bradbury
books.summary: In a future society where books are banned and burned, Guy Montag, a fireman, questions his role and begins to rebel against the oppressive regime.

books.title: Hyperion
books.author: Dan Simmons
books.summary: A group of pilgrims travels to the mysterious planet of Hyperion, each with their own story and purpose, as they encounter enigmatic creatures known as the Shrike.

books.title: The Left Hand of Darkness
books.author: Ursula K. Le Guin
books.summary: Genly Ai, an envoy from Earth, visits the planet of Gethen where the inhabitants have no fixed gender, leading to a thought-provoking exploration of sexuality and identity.

books.title: The Time Machine
books.author: H.G. Wells
books.summary: An inventor builds a time machine and travels to the future, witnessing the evolution of humanity and encountering two distinct species: the Eloi and the Morlocks.

books.title: A Wrinkle in Time
books.author: Madeleine L'Engle
books.summary: Meg Murry, her brother Charles Wallace, and their friend Calvin O'Keefe embark on a journey through space and time to rescue Meg's father from the clutches of an evil force.

books.title: The Martian
books.author: Andy Weir
books.summary: Stranded alone on Mars, astronaut Mark Watney must use his ingenuity to survive and find a way to communicate with Earth for a chance of rescue.

books.title: Starship Troopers
books.author: Robert A. Heinlein
books.summary: In a future where Earth is at war with insectoid aliens, Juan Rico joins the military and becomes a soldier in the interstellar conflict.

books.title: The Hunger Games
books.author: Suzanne Collins
books.summary: In a dystopian society, Katniss Everdeen volunteers for the Hunger Games, a televised fight to the death, to protect her sister and challenge the oppressive regime.

books.title: I, Robot
books.author: Isaac Asimov
books.summary: A collection of interconnected stories exploring the relationship between humans and robots, delving into the ethical and moral implications of artificial intelligence.

books.title: The Forever War
books.author: Joe Haldeman
books.summary: William Mandella, a soldier fighting in an interstellar war against an alien species, experiences time dilation and finds himself aging at a different rate than Earth.

books.title: The Handmaid's Tale
books.author: Margaret Atwood
books.summary: In a totalitarian society, Offred is a handmaid assigned to bear children for the ruling class, as she navigates a world of oppression and rebellion.

books.title: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
books.author: Philip K. Dick
books.summary: In a post-apocalyptic world, bounty hunter Rick Deckard is tasked with hunting down rogue androids known as replicants, leading him to question his own humanity.

books.title: The Road
books.author: Cormac McCarthy
books.summary: A father and his young son journey through a desolate and dangerous landscape, struggling to survive and maintain their humanity in a world ravaged by an unspecified catastrophe.

books.title: Childhood's End
books.author: Arthur C. Clarke
books.summary: Alien Overlords known as the Overlords arrive on Earth, bringing peace and prosperity, but at the cost of humanity's individuality and future evolution.

books.title: The Stand
books.author: Stephen King
books.summary: After a deadly pandemic wipes out most of the world's population, a group of survivors must confront both the physical and supernatural threats that arise in the aftermath.

books.title: The Dispossessed
books.author: Ursula K. Le Guin
books.summary: Shevek, a physicist from the anarchist society of Anarres, travels to the capitalist planet of Urras, leading to a clash of ideologies and a reflection on the nature of freedom.

books.title: The Day of the Triffids
books.author: John Wyndham
books.summary: After a meteor shower blinds most of humanity, aggressive plants known as triffids begin to take over, posing a threat to the remaining sighted survivors.

books.title: The Time Traveler's Wife
books.author: Audrey Niffenegger
books.summary: Henry, a time traveler, and his wife Clare navigate their complex relationship as they deal with the challenges and consequences of his involuntary time jumps.

books.title: The Road to Dune
books.author: Frank Herbert, Brian Herbert, Kevin J. Anderson
books.summary: A collection of short stories and essays related to the Dune series, providing additional insights into the world and characters created by Frank Herbert.

books.title: The Invisible Man
books.author: H.G. Wells
books.summary: A scientist discovers the secret of invisibility but struggles to control his newfound power, leading to a descent into madness and a reign of terror.

books.title: The Maze Runner
books.author: James Dashner
books.summary: Thomas wakes up in a maze with no memory of his past, joining a group of other teenagers known as Gladers as they try to escape the deadly labyrinth.

books.title: The Giver
books.author: Lois Lowry
books.summary: In a seemingly utopian society, Jonas is chosen to receive memories of the past, discovering the dark secrets behind his community's perfect facade.

books.title: The Andromeda Strain
books.author: Michael Crichton
books.summary: A team of scientists investigates a deadly extraterrestrial microorganism that causes a small town's population to die off rapidly, racing against time to prevent a global pandemic.

books.title: The Windup Girl
books.author: Paolo Bacigalupi
books.summary: Set in a future where biotechnology is dominant, the story follows a genetically engineered woman known as a windup girl, caught in a web of political and corporate intrigue.

books.title: The Forever War
books.author: Dexter Filkins
books.summary: A journalist's account of the Iraq War, chronicling the experiences of soldiers and civilians caught in the conflict and the long-lasting impact on individuals and nations.

books.title: The Diamond Age
books.author: Neal Stephenson
books.summary: In a future world divided by social classes, a young girl named Nell receives a stolen interactive book that leads her on a journey of self-discovery and revolution.

books.title: The Man in the High Castle
books.author: Philip K. Dick
books.summary: In an alternate history where the Axis powers won World War II, the United States is divided between Nazi Germany and Imperial Japan, and a mysterious novel challenges the status quo.

books.title: Red Mars
books.author: Kim Stanley Robinson
books.summary: A group of scientists and engineers embark on a mission to colonize and terraform Mars, facing numerous challenges and conflicts as they shape the future of the planet.

books.title: The City & the City
books.author: China Miéville
books.summary: Inspector Tyador Borlú investigates a murder that spans two cities occupying the same physical space, but with strict rules of separation and a mysterious force known as Breach.

books.title: The Lathe of Heaven
books.author: Ursula K. Le Guin
books.summary: George Orr has the power to alter reality through his dreams, leading to a series of unintended and often disastrous consequences as his therapist tries to exploit this ability.

books.title: The Three-Body Problem
books.author: Liu Cixin
books.summary: When a secret military project on Earth makes contact with an alien civilization, humanity becomes embroiled in a struggle for survival against a powerful and enigmatic enemy.

books.title: Altered Carbon
books.author: Richard K. Morgan
books.summary: In a future where consciousness can be transferred to different bodies, ex-Envoy Takeshi Kovacs is hired to solve the murder of a wealthy man, uncovering a conspiracy along the way.

books.title: The Fifth Season
books.author: N.K. Jemisin
books.summary: In a world plagued by catastrophic climate events known as Fifth Seasons, a woman named Essun embarks on a journey to find her missing daughter, uncovering the truth about her own powers.

books.title: The Hyperion Cantos
books.author: Dan Simmons
books.summary: A series of interconnected novels, Hyperion follows a group of pilgrims as they share their stories and confront the enigmatic Shrike, a time-traveling creature of immense power.

books.title: The Quantum Thief
books.author: Hannu Rajaniemi
books.summary: In a future where privacy is a commodity and minds can be uploaded and hacked, master thief Jean le Flambeur is caught in a game of cat and mouse with a powerful enemy.

books.title: The Stars My Destination
books.author: Alfred Bester
books.summary: Gully Foyle, a man left for dead in space, survives and seeks revenge against those who abandoned him, gaining the ability to teleport and becoming a force to be reckoned with.

books.title: The Player of Games
books.author: Iain M. Banks
books.summary: Jernau Morat Gurgeh, a master game player, is sent to the Empire of Azad to participate in a complex and dangerous game that holds political and cultural significance.

books.title: The Road to Reality
books.author: Roger Penrose
books.summary: A comprehensive exploration of the fundamental principles of physics and mathematics, delving into topics such as quantum mechanics, relativity, and the nature of the universe.

books.title: The Wind's Twelve Quarters
books.author: Ursula K. Le Guin
books.summary: A collection of short stories by Ursula K. Le Guin, showcasing her mastery of the genre and her ability to explore complex themes through diverse and imaginative narratives.

books.title: The Demolished Man
books.author: Alfred Bester
books.summary: In a future where telepathy is common, Ben Reich plans to commit a murder but must outwit the telepathic police force led by the relentless detective Lincoln Powell.

books.title: The Diamond Age
books.author: Neal Stephenson
books.summary: In a future world divided by social classes, a young girl named Nell receives a stolen interactive book that leads her on a journey of self-discovery and revolution.
